prompt: <description>part 1 Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The sides are parallel and the top and bottom faces are perpendicular to the sides. The dimensions of the sides are equal and the height is half the width. Begin by creating a new coordinate system: * Set the Euler angles to (0.0, 0.0, -90.0) * Set the translation vector to (0.0, 0.5369, 0.0) Next, create the 2D sketch: * Create a new face (face\\_1) * On this face, draw a loop (loop\\_1) consisting of: + Line 1: Starting at (0.0, 0.0), ending at (0.4422, 0.0) + Line 2: Starting at (0.4422, 0.0), ending at (0.4422, 0.3645) + Line 3: Starting at (0.4422, 0.3645), ending at (0.0, 0.3645) + Line 4: Starting at (0.0, 0.3645), ending at (0.0, 0.0) Now, scale the 2D sketch into a 3D model using the provided scaling parameter and euler angles: * Set the sketch scale to 0.4422 * Set the extrusion depth towards the normal to 0.0 * Set the extrusion depth opposite the normal to 0.2131 part 2 Construct a cylindrical object with a tapered end, resembling a metallic tube or pipe. Begin by creating a new coordinate system: * Set the Euler angles to (0.0, 0.0, -90.0) * Set the translation vector to (0.1065, 0.5369, 0.1182) Next, create the 2D sketch: * Create a new face (face\\_1) * On this face, draw a loop (loop\\_1) consisting of: + Circle 1: Centered at (0.0761, 0.0761) with radius 0.0761 Now, scale the 2D sketch into a 3D model using the provided scaling parameter and euler angles: * Set the sketch scale to 0.1521 * Set the extrusion depth towards the normal to 0.5369 * Set the extrusion depth opposite the normal to 0.0 Note: The final shape of the assembly is a rectangular block with a cylindrical hole in the center and a cylindrical rod attached at one end. The cylindrical hole is half the width of the block and the diameter of the rod is equal to the diameter of the hole. The block and rod are both gray in color.</description>
